title: Off-site GEO: when it helps, when it harms
content:
Off-site GEO: when it helps, when it harms

List external mentions that support citation, and avoid spam.

Learning goal

  • List useful off-site sources (reviews, media, partners).
  • Avoid spammy mentions.

Why it matters

  • AI may consider external mentions.
  • Spammy links can hurt.

Explanation

  • Useful: credible review sites, relevant media, partner blogs.
  • Harmful: link farms, paid spam, irrelevant directories.

Examples

  • Good: real test article link, partner Q&A.
  • Poor: link farm, keyword-stuffed page.

Guided exercise (10–15 min)

  1. Create lists: useful vs avoid sources.
  2. Select 2 credible sources and draft placement.

Independent exercise (5–10 min)

Write an outreach draft for a partner article or Q&A.

Self-check

  • Useful/avoid lists ready.
  • 2 credible sources picked.
  • Outreach draft ready.

Optional deepening

  • Google spam policies: https://developers.google.com/search/docs/essentials/spam-policies
